#Text=Garcia
#Text=II of Kongo

#Text=Garcia II Nkanga a Lukeni a Nzenze a Ntumba , also known as Garcia Afonso for short , [ 1 ] ruled the Kingdom of Kongo from 23 January 1641 to 1661 ; he is sometimes considered Kongo 's greatest king for his religious piety and his near expulsion of the Portuguese from Angola .
#Text=Early life
#Text=Garcia and his brother Álvaro Nimi were born in the early seventeenth century .
#Text=Both brothers attended the Jesuit college at São Salvador ( modern M'banza-Kongo ) soon after it was opened in 1620 where they studied with the Jesuit priest João de Paiva .
#Text=They joined the lay brotherhood of St. Ignatius while students .
#Text=During his youth , Garcia obtained the nickname Kipaku ( Quipaco ) of uncertain meaning .
#Text=When King Álvaro V was threatened by Daniel da Silva , Duke of Mbamba in 1634 the brothers came to the king 's aid .
#Text=Garcia was particularly valiant during the desperate battle which took place in the County of Soyo as the royal army was backed up against the river .
#Text=Garcia was rewarded for his bravery by being named Marquis of Kiova , a small territory on the south bank of the Congo River , while his brother was promoted to Duke of Mbamba .

#Text=However , in 1636 Álvaro V sought to remove the brothers and kill them , and in defense they managed to defeat and behead the king . Álvaro was then crowned King Álvaro VI and named Garcia as Duke of Mbamba .
#Text=Taking the Throne and the Dutch War
#Text=On 22 January 1641 Álvaro died in mysterious circumstances , and before the election could be held Garcia moved forces from Mbamba to the capital and forced them to declare him king .
#Text=He almost immediately faced a crisis , however , for within a few weeks Paulo , the Count of Soyo and longtime ally died and was replaced by his rival and Garcia 's enemy Daniel da Silva .
#Text=At the same time that this happened , the Dutch armada invaded and took the Portuguese colony of Luanda .
#Text=Kongo had a long term pact to assist the Dutch in driving the Portuguese out of Angola , and he immediately moved his armies south to assist .

#Text=In 1642 he received an embassy from the Dutch and signed an alliance and agreement , only refusing to permit them to send him a Calvinist preacher , insisting that he was a Catholic and would not permit it .
#Text=Garcia hoped that the Dutch would assist him in driving the Portuguese out of Angola , as these terms had been laid down as early as 1622 , when Pedro II had proposed the Kongo-Dutch alliance .
#Text=However , the Dutch were not as willing to press their attack home once they had taken Luanda .
#Text=Instead , they hoped to make it a trading post and allowed the Portuguese to continue to possess their inland territories .
#Text=Dutch soldiers , however , helped Garcia defeat a rebellion in the small southern district of Nsala in 1642 , the slaves captured from this paying for Dutch expenses in taking Luanda .

#Text=In 1643 , as the relations between the Dutch West India Company and the Portuguese broke down , Garcia 's forces assisted in driving the Portuguese from their positions on the Bengo River , though again the Dutch refused to press the attack home and the Portuguese regrouped at Massangano , further inland .
#Text=However , increasingly hostile relations between Garcia and Daniel da Silva prevented him from committing forces to the campaign against Portugal .
#Text=Thus , in 1645 Garcia sought to drive Daniel from Soyo , but was defeated trying to take the Soyo fortified position at Mfinda Ngula .
#Text=His son and would be heir , Afonso , leading the Kongo forces was captured , and a campaign to free him in 1646 failed also .

#Text=Because of these wars , Kongo was only able to send small forces , when the Dutch , fearing that reinforced Portuguese might drive them from Luanda , declared all out war in conjunction with Queen Njinga of Matamba .
#Text=Although the allies were successful at the Battle of Kombi in 1647 , they were unable to dislodge the Portuguese from their forts .
#Text=Further reinforcements from Brazil in 1648 forced the Dutch to withdraw .
#Text=Following the Portuguese Restoration
#Text=In the years following the Dutch war , Garcia sought to make amends with the Portuguese and settle relations .

#Text=Salvador Correia de Sá , the Portuguese governor sought to demand that Garcia sign a harsh treaty in the aftermath of his victory over the Dutch , claiming the Island of Luanda , all lands south of the Bengo River , the rights to all mines in Kongo , payment of an indemnity , and other major concessions .
#Text=Garcia 's version of the treaty insisted on restoration of his rights south of the Bengo River as well as other demands .
#Text=The treaty was presented in 1649 , neither side signed it , though Garcia did pay an indemnity .
#Text=Garcia turned his attention to internal affairs following the Dutch period .
#Text=Capuchin missionaries , who arrived from Italy and Spain in 1645 assisted in providing more clergy for the Church , and Garcia welcomed them to his country .

#Text=However , always suspicious , he accused them of plotting against them in 1652 , and in the same year he imprisoned Doña Leonor , an aged and well respected queen for her involvement in an alleged plot .
#Text=She died in prison and Garcia lost considerable public confidence as a result .
#Text=He attempted once again in 1655 to take Soyo , and the next year , two sons of Pedro II , members of the House of Nsundi ( or the Kinkanga a Mvika ) tried to overthrow him .
#Text=The Portuguese intervened on their behalf and might have attacked Kongo .

#Text=However , Garcia was able to defeat the brothers and at the same time prevent the Portuguese , who remembered their crushing defeat following the Battle of Mbumbi in 1622 , from crossing the Loje River .
#Text=By 1657 , Garcia II had annihilated or absorbed the rest of the House of Nsundi .
#Text=Garcia died in 1660 , leaving his second son António I of Kongo to succeed him .
